Not entirely sure if this is the right place to post this, but I figured I would, since this is the designer's thread.

I'm having an issue with the Jool V fuel tanks and stock ladders. Whenever I try to climb down a series of ladders attached to the side of a Jool V large tank -- specifically, when going from the static rung ladders to the deployable folding ones -- my kerbalnauts keep getting killed. The flight log tells me that they're somehow crashing into the fuel tank whenever they try to go from one ladder to the other.

Going from rungs on the 2m-3m adapter to a fold-out ladder on the fuel tank? *poof*

From rungs to fold-out, both on the fuel tank? *poof*

Letting go of the rungs, then trying to catch the ladder? When he reaches the top of the fold-out ladder, *poof*

I've tried reproducing the issue on all-stock setups, but everything works without any problems on those. It seems to be isolated to the Jool V parts.

Any help y'all could give me would be greatly appreciated

EDIT: In case it helps, here's a pic of the craft in question, although the screenshot is from a version from before I added the ladders.

Edited May 4, 2013 by Specialist290
That's not only a problem with Jool V parts, the largest KW 3m tank also shows this problem. This might be an issue with large tanks in general.
What's the correct order to install all the BobCat mods in? Some of them contain the same plugin, for example, but different versions of it. I think I keep installing in wrong order and crashing.

What's the correct order to install all the BobCat mods in? Some of them contain the same plugin, for example, but different versions of it. I think I keep installing in wrong order and crashing.

Just don't overwrite the most recents one...

Just don't overwrite the most recents one...

I don't know what that means. Can you tell me the correct install order?
no one i think just knows it, you have to look at the modified dates and not overwrite the most recent ones

I don't know what that means. Can you tell me the correct install order?

There's no order. When you put mods with the same plug-in in your folder, it'll ask you if you want to overwrite it. Do it unless the one you're trying to overwrite is older than the one overwriting.

There's no order.

No there is an order. It is the order that the versions of included plugin are most recent, which could be assumed to be the order he released them in. Do you know what this order is?

No there is an order. It is the order that the versions of included plugin are most recent, which could be assumed to be the order he released them in. Do you know what this order is?

As previous people said, just look at the modify date on the plugin and put the latest date last. The only common file between them is the plugin, so that is the only file to be concerned about.

Download the latest CBC plugin at https://cleverbobcat.codeplex.com/

DON'T OVERWRITE THIS!!!

Then install as normal.

Godspeed and goodluck.
